timeline.message: KEYCLOAK-14973 Remove CreatedType abstraction, create method for time bounded execution on providers
KEYCLOAK-14973 Remove CreatedType abstraction, create method for time bounded execution on providers

timeline.bodyText: I believe this can be omitted. Failing the check would cause and exception raised here in runtime, or some sort of exception (likely related to class-casting) later. From my POV, a proper check should be rather on the factory level.
timeline.author: hmlnarik

replies.bodyText: I agree I will remove the TODO comment.
replies.author: mhajas

revised_code.chunk:
diff --git a/services/src/main/java/org/keycloak/storage/AbstractStorageManager.java b/services/src/main/java/org/keycloak/storage/AbstractStorageManager.java
index 61ae3dc2ec..c0aaa6a9f6 100644
--- a/services/src/main/java/org/keycloak/storage/AbstractStorageManager.java
+++ b/services/src/main/java/org/keycloak/storage/AbstractStorageManager.java

@@ -132,14 +132,6 @@ public abstract class AbstractStorageManager<ProviderType extends Provider,
      * @return an instance of type CreatedProviderType
      */
     protected ProviderType getStorageProviderInstance(StorageProviderModelType model) {
-        // TODO: Add type checking.
-        //  Original storage manager is using {@code Types.supports(type, factory, ClientStorageProviderFactory.class)} for checking whether class
-        //  provided by factory implements {@code ClientLookupProvider}, this check doesn't work here, because these lines:
-        //  https://github.com/keycloak/keycloak/blob/master/common/src/main/java/org/keycloak/common/util/reflections/Types.java#L490-L491
-        //  were returning Object.class which obviously doesn't have any type parameters and hence it fails. I played a bit with it,
-        //  and I was able to workaround it when using {@code root.getGenericInterfaces()}, but then I removed it, as I am not sure
-        //  this is kind of change we want as part of GroupStorageManager work. This check is omitted also in
-        //  {@link org.keycloak.storage.ClientStorageManager} when using {@link ClientStorageManager.getStorageProvider}
         if (model == null || !model.isEnabled()) {
             return null;
         }
